title: Subarray Sum Equals K
description: Given an array of integers and an integer K, find the total number of continuous subarrays whose sum equals to K.
input_format: An integer array nums, followed by an integer k.
output_format: An integer representing the total number of continuous subarrays whose sum equals K.

examples.explanation: The subarrays are [1, 1] (from index 0 to 1) and [1, 1] (from index 1 to 2).
The subarrays are [3] (from index 2) and [1, 2] (from index 0 to 1).

hints: Use a hash map to store the cumulative frequencies.

title: Rotate Array
description: Given an array of integers, you need to rotate the array to the right by k steps, where k is non-negative. This means that for every element in the array, its index will change to (index + k) % n, where n is the length of the array. The rotate operation should be done in-place, meaning you need to modify the input array directly without using additional space for a new array.
input_format: An array of integers nums followed by an integer k.

examples.explanation: Rotating the array [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7] to the right by 3 steps results in [5, 6, 7, 1, 2, 3, 4].
Rotating the array [-1, -100, 3, 99] to the right by 2 steps results in [3, 99, -1, -100].

hints: Consider using reverse operations to accomplish the rotation.
Remember to handle cases where k is greater than the length of the array.
